New Records: Liam Livingstone fell with the scores level, he cracked Short for six and four, then missed a whip across the line and was bowled. He shakes his head in frustration as he walks off, but this has been a marvellous innings: 87 from 47 balls with six fours and five sixes.
Key Match Events: WICKET! England 193-7 (Carse c David b Short 0)
WICKET! England 171-5 (S Curran c Connolly b Short 1)
Liam Livingstone lorded over that game, taking 2 for 16 from three overs before smashing five sixes in a pulsating 87
WICKET! England 34-1 (Jacks c Fraser-McGurk b Abbott 12)
Pre-Game Insights: That looks a tall order on a pitch that looks awkward when pace comes off the ball. England need to go huge in the Powerplay.
Post-Match Reflections: Liam Livingstone is the player of the match

It’s been nice. I did say towards the end of The Hundred that I felt like I was getting my body back to normal, which hasn’t been the case for a while. The last couple of years have taught me a few life lessons. I’m enjoying my cricket and playing with a smile on my face.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Liam Livingstone reacts after he is bowled out by Australia's Matthew Short
England's Liam Livingstone (centre) and and Phil Salt (right) celebrate after the match.
